ARABIC: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So He threw down his staff and there it was, unmistakably a snake.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: At this Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it became a live serpent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Thereupon Moses threw his rod, and suddenly it was a veritable serpent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: So Moses threw down his staff and suddenly it turned into a real serpent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Therefore Moosa put down his staff – it immediately turned into a visible python.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then [Musa] threw his staff and behold! it was a [Thu`ban] serpent, manifest!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So he threw his rod, then lo! it was a clear serpent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So he cast his staff; and behold, it was a serpent manifest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then he flung down his staff and lo! it was a serpent manifest;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then Moses threw down his staff and suddenly, unmistakably, it appeared as a serpent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Thereupon he cast down his rod, when, lo it was a serpent manifest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Thereat he threw down his staff, and behold, it became a manifest python.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then (Moses) threw his rod, and behold! it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then [Musa (Moses)] threw his stick and behold! it was a serpent, manifest!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He threw down his staff, and it was clearly a serpent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So he threw his staff, and it was an apparent serpent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So Moses threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent, manifest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [7:107] Then he cast down his staff and lo! it was a serpent, manifest [for all to see], an enormous snake.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then he flung down his staff) the first token (and lo! it was a serpent manifest) a yellow, male serpent: a huge one;
